$!To become a taxi driver you need to be aged 21 or over and have a Transport for London (TfL) drivers licence. To run a private hire business you will need 1 of 2 driver’s licences. $!

The 2 types of driver's licences are:

- a small operator's licence – up to 2 vehicles for private hire bookings
- a standard operator's licence -  as many vehicles as you like

Each licence has a [fee](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/1356.aspx "Operators licences fees"){:rel="external"} and lasts for 5 years.

%You can be prosecuted if you receive payment for taking bookings or supply drivers for hire without an operator's licence.%

##Taxi drivers##

You will need to apply for a [drivers licence for private hire or taxis](/driving-licences-private-hire-taxis-london "Driving licences for private hire or taxis in London") issued by Transport for London (TfL).

##Getting a private hire operator licence in London##

If you want to run a business as a private hire operator in London, you will need to get an [operator's licence for private hire or taxis](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/1352.aspx "Operators licence"){:rel="external"} from TfL. This includes businesses such as driving a minicab or stretch limousine. 

You'll also need a [vehicle licence for private hire or taxis](/vehicle-licences-private-hire-taxis-london "Vehicle licences for private hire or taxis in London") for your taxi and a [driver's licence](/driving-licences-private-hire-taxis-london "Driving licences for private hire or taxis in London"). 

*[TfL]: Transport for London
overview: What you need to do to get a taxi or private vehicle hire operator's licence
title: Operator licences for running a private hire or taxi business in London
